Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Recombinant Factor VIIa for Bleeding Prevention and Treatment

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either rFVIIa or placebo.

Participants.evidence: The study setting and participant eligibility criteria were not detailed.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either rFVIIa or placebo.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates its effectiveness in such contexts.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality, with secondary outcomes including blood loss, red cell transfusion requirements, and thromboembolic events.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding involved patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 4290 participants were randomised, with 2607 receiving rFVIIa.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted using an unspecified approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Prophylactic use in 1361 participants showed no mortality benefit (RR 1.04; 95% CI 0.55 to 1.97) but reduced blood loss (MD -297 mL; 95% CI -416 to -178) and transfusion needs (MD -261 mL; 95% CI -367 to -154).

Harms.evidence: Increased thromboembolic events were noted (RR 1.45; 95% CI 1.02 to 2.05).
